[b][color=white]Downtime[/color][/b]
Hack Forums recently had a 10 hour long downtime due to server conflicts. According to [b][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#ff3eab]Omniscient[/color][/url][/b], the server ran updates and the updates messed with the PHP service which resulted in the entire forum to be offline until Omniscient started the service back up. All good though, nothing serious.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5524036] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[hr]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/327.png[/img][/align]

[align=center]
[color=1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596]Minimalist[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[hr]

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Hello Minimalist, and welcome to the HF News.  Before we start is there any shout outs you would like to make?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: Yeah: I'd like to make a quick mention of everybody in Eclipse, spooky black, and Gigabear.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Awesome shout outs.  So, I suppose the first and starter question is what brought you to Hack Forums to start?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: I joined Hack Forums in August 2013 after a competing forum closed. I can't remember what my profile stats were like on that forum, but at that point, I had little knowledge of computers (& software) and their workings. Despite this, I pushed past my ignorance and started to learn how to code.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: So, you joined Hack Forums to better your knowledge on coding and programming languages, how did that go?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: Great, actually! The first practical application for my journey was at a robotics competition in Ontario, where I programmed a 'bot in C++ and won first place with some buddies of mine.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: That is fantastic, a success story I suppose.  But your focuses changed it would seem, given post activity, you became very in depth with the community.  Your activity in the deal dispute sections, attempting to resolve others issues, offering middle man services, and even your own currency exchange service, which I personally used numerous times myself.  What drove you towards this ambition?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: I feel like it just happened by itself, I can't remember why I started doing anything of those. Everything may have came about because of my interest in CS:GO item trading...but again, I don't remember.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Fair enough, Given you offer a middle man service and the state of the HF marketplace what have you seen and what are your best recommendations to new users who are attempting to enter our marketplace for the first time?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: Try not to be lured in by clickbait thread titles and product advertisements. * and always use a middleman, but even that should be done with caution.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Very wise words.  So, I suppose on to the more updated stuff.   It would seem as some may have said playing "Mini mod" got you somewhere good.  Before I address your new Staff role, I would however like to touch on how in the hell you managed to become the walking HF Dictionary?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: http://webvivant.com/what-we-do/sample-features/google-hacking-101/

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: So you literally just Google Dorked the hell out of everything?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: Yeah lol, figured my way around things after I was chastised for reposts.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: Well, thats one hell of a method, I must admit. :) All that being said, having this knowledge got you an Offer from the Big Purple, Omni himself for Staff.  Gotta ask as I am sure many wonder, whats that feel like?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: Exciting for the first few hours and then you get hounded by users and reports. The work's done in the best interest of us staff though, I'll probably come to enjoy it once I'm done with my exams.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada[/b][/color][/url]: I can only imagine the reports alone, plus the addition of PMs.  Hope you guys get extra inbox space. ;-) Well, it has been a pleasure as usual talking to you, before we wrap this interview up, is there anything more you would like to add or say?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1915596][color=#C71585][b]Minimalist[/b][/color][/url]: ✌

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[hr]

[b][color=white]Another Week, Another Edition[/color][/b]
Thanks for reading, hope you enjoyed the edition. We always welcome, and appreciate any kind of feedback. -Z
[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/WorldNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Trump becomes 45th President of the United States[/color][/b]
On Friday, Donald Trump became the 45th President of the United States, vowing to always put America first. He arrived at the White House around 5 a.m. ET, following a day of tradition. In a ceromony that was held earlier that afternoon, Trump placed his left hand on a family Bible, promising to preserve, protect and defend the Constitution. With his new first lady, Melania, Trump took the oath of office from Chief Justice John Roberts. When Trump's inaugural address took place, he told the country that they would "never be ignored again", with former Presidents George W. Bush, Bill Clinton and Jimmy Carter in the audience; even Hilary Clinton, whom Trump defeated in November's poll.[i][size=x-small][url=http://edition.cnn.com/2017/01/20/politics/donald-trump-inauguration-highlights/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Babies used in suicide bombings, officials warn[/color][/b]
Officials have warned that female suicide bombers have been carrying babies during their attacks to avoid detection. Witnesses saw an attack happen in the town of Madagali on January 13, killing themselves, two babies and four others. Officials claim that the use of babies could produce a very dangerous trend. The attack has been said to be carried out by group Boko Haram, which are a group that are known for using women, including young girls, in their attacks. In response to the Nigerian government fighting against these attacks, insurgents have ramped up their suicide bombings to respond. Two females killed 45 people in the same town at a busy market in early December, followed by similar attacks.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38725976] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/5EHiJAb.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][url=https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2016/08/helping-users-easily-access-content-on.html][b]Google's Intrusive Mobile Pop-Up Penalty is Being Rolled Out[/b][/url][/color]
Thanks to Google's new intrusive pop-up penalty, any mobile web page that uses interstitials (pages displayed before the expected page) and pop-ups will see their Google ranking tumble. Originally announced back in August 2016, Google confirmed that the new algorithm update has officially gone live as of January 10th. Google's goal is to preserve the user experience of its searchers. When searchers click on a search result, they expect to be taken to a page where they can see the content that fulfills their search. Interstitials and pop-ups that cover the expected content detract from that experience, according to Google, resulting in a frustrating experience. 

[color=white][url=https://newsroom.uber.com/amit-singhal/][b]Uber Hires Google's Former Head of Search Amit Singhal[/b][/url][/color]
Uber's newest hire has quite the accomplished history in Silicon Valley — Amit Singhal, the former Google engineer who played an integral role in developing the search engine's ranking algorithm, has come out of retirement to join the ride-hailing company as Senior Vice President of Engineering. Singhal will report directly to Uber CEO Travis Kalanick, and will work alongside Anthony Levandowski, Vice President of Engineering and head of Uber's self-driving car division. He will head up the ride-hailing startup's Maps and Marketplace division, and will work to scale up Uber's self-driving engineering unit. In a blog post on his personal website, Singhal described the opportunity as "exciting or potentially world-changing."

[color=white][url=http://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2017/01/fcc-to-be-led-by-ajit-pai-staunch-opponent-of-consumer-protection-rules/][b]Ajit Pai Expected to be Announced as Next FCC Chairmen[/b][/url][/color]
Ajit Pai, a Republican Federal Communications Commission member and foe of net neutrality regulation, will reportedly be named to head the agency when Chairman Tom Wheeler steps down today. Pai, who was nominated by President Obama and served as the senior Republican commissioner, would not require Senate approval and his new position could be announced as early as Friday afternoon, outlets report. Pai has been a reliably conservative voice, often speaking out for deregulation and opposing progressive measures from the Democratic majority.
[/align]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/HackingNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]80% of Internet of Things Devices are Insecure[/color][/b]
Recently, a study was conducted on Mobile and IoT Application Security by Ponemon Institute that found that 80 percent of Internet of Things devices aren't secured and have vulnerabilities. According to Arxan Technologies Chief Marketing Officer, Mandeep Khera, "IoT is still fairly new and due to lack of a big visible hack or a regulation, organizations have hard time justifying security initiatives." Additionally, Khera stated that one of the biggest issues is that most professionals lack an understanding of potential vulnerabilities and impacts of hacks on such devices.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.ehackingnews.com/2017/01/80-of-internet-of-thingsiot-are.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Anyone Can Crash an iPhone Using Just Emojis[/color][/b]
Apple's iOS has been found to contain a bug that allows a prankster to crash an iPhone or iPad using a simple emoji message. YouTuber EverythingApplePro published a video showing the sequence of emojis that causes the iPhone to freeze and restart. The simple text simply contains: a white flag emoji, the digit "0", and a rainbow emoji. When sent, the iPhone restarts after it tries to combine it as a rainbow flag.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.hackersnewsbulletin.com/2017/01/crash-iphone-using-emoji.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Over 199,500 Websites are Still Vulnerable to Heartbleed[/color][/b]
The OpenSSL Heartbleed exploit was discovered over two and a half years ago, but many organizations have still failed to patch their systems. It was one of the biggest issues in internet history that affected security of the core of two-thirds of the world's servers. A report published on Shodan, a search engine for vulnerable devices, showed that the bug still remains unpatched on over 199,500 systems--2 years and 9 months after its discovery.[i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/01/heartbleed-openssl-vulnerability.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Final Fantasy 15's Limited-Time Carnival Event[/color][/b]
Final Fantasy XV's Moogle Chocobo Carnival event is soon to be underway. We now have a better idea of what to expect, thanks to a new trailer. The carnival launches as part of a recently unveiled update that adds the ability to take your own photographs outside of battle (something that's briefly shown in the video), a photo frame, and a costume for Noctis. But it's the carnival itself that is the main attraction. The limited-time event kicks off in North America on January 23 at 5 PM PT / 8 PM ET. It decorates Altissia and introduces new food, Noctis outfits, and side quests. There's also fishing, chocobo racing, and at least one carnival game to take part in, a sort of shooting gallery. Square Enix didn't say how long it will run for. This will all be available on both PS4 and Xbox One. To access the carnival, you'll need the Carnival Passport item, which is included for free with the Holiday Pack DLC. You can download either the free or paid version of that DLC to receive the item. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.vg247.com/2016/12/16/final-fantasy-15-holiday-pack-dlc-includes-a-ticket-to-a-carnival-in-january-update-adds-ng-frames-for-photo-sharing/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Injustice 2 Beta Confirmed, Registration Now Live[/color][/b]
It's been a big week for Injustice 2. Publisher Warner Bros. released an awesome-looking story trailer and confirmed that Darkseid is joining the roster, but the only way to get him is to preorder right away, apparently. Additionally, information about the game's various premium editions was revealed. Following a tease earlier today, an online beta test for Injustice 2 has now been confirmed. You can sign up to take part here, though there's no indication of when it starts or how many people will be accepted. The test will be available on both PS4 and Xbox One; you'll need to choose one of the two platforms you want to receive access on when registering. Some of the playable characters in Injustice 2 include Harley Quinn, Deadshot, Batman, Superman, Supergirl, Aquaman, Atrocitus, Gorilla Grodd, Blue Beetle, and Wonder Woman. Injustice 2 launches on May 16 for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.[i][size=x-small][url=https://beta.injustice.com/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]
